SEARCH
Package org.rcmd.jneuroformats

Class FsLabel

java.lang.Object
org.rcmd.jneuroformats.FsLabel
public class FsLabel extends Object
Models a FreeSurfer label, can be a surface label or a volume label. The label is defined by a set of vertices or voxels that are part of the structure, and a value that is assigned to all vertices or voxels that are part of the structure. Sometimes the value is not needed, and can be set to 0.

    • size

      public int size()
      Return the number of vertices or voxels that are part of the label.
      Returns:
      the number of vertices or voxels that are part of the label.

    • validate

      public void validate() throws IOException
      Validate that the label is internally consistent, i.e. that all lists have the same number of elements.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the label is not internally consistent.

    • elementIndexIsPartOfLabel

      public List<Boolean> elementIndexIsPartOfLabel(int numberOfElements)
      Compute for all vertices whether they are part of the label.
      Parameters:
      numberOfElements - the total number of vertices in the surface, or voxels in the volume the label is defined on.
      Returns:
      a Boolean list, containing at position i whether vertex (or voxel) with index i is part of this label.

    • fromFsLabelFile

      protected static FsLabel fromFsLabelFile(Path filePath) throws IOException, FileNotFoundException
      Read a file in FreeSurfer label format and return a FsLabel object.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the name of the file to read, as a Path object. Get on from a string by something like `java.nio.file.Paths.Path.get("myfile.txt")`.
      Returns:
      an FsLabel object.
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.
      FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist.

    • toCsvFormat

      public String toCsvFormat(Boolean with_header)
      Generate string representation of this FsLabel in CSV format.
      Parameters:
      with_header - whether to include a header row at the top of the CSV.
      Returns:
      the CSV format string

    • fromCsvFile

      protected static FsLabel fromCsvFile(Path filePath, Boolean has_header) throws IOException, FileNotFoundException
      Read a file in CSV format and return an FsLabel object.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the name of the file to read, as a Path object. Get on from a string by something like `java.nio.file.Paths.Path.get("myfile.txt")`. The file format is assumed to be CSV, with 5 columns in this order: index, coordx, coordy, coordz, value. The datatypes of the columns are integer for the index column, and float for all other columns.
      has_header - whether the file has a header row at the top.
      Returns:
      an FsLabel object.
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.
      FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist.

    • read

      public static FsLabel read(Path filePath) throws IOException, FileNotFoundException
      Read a file in CSV or FreeSurfer label format and return an FsLabel object.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the name of the file to read, as a Path object. Get on from a string by something like `java.nio.file.Paths.Path.get("myfile.txt")`. The file format is assumed to be CSV, with 5 columns in this order: index, coordx, coordy, coordz, value. The datatypes of the columns are integer for the index column, and float for all other columns.
      Returns:
      an FsLabel object.
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.
      FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist.h

    • toFsLabelFormat

      public String toFsLabelFormat()
      Generate string representation of this FsLabel in FsLabel format.
      Returns:
      the FsLabel format string

    • write

      public void write(Path filePath, String format) throws IOException
      Write this label to a file in CSV or FsLabel format.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the file to write to
      format - the format to write in, either "csv" or "fslabel".
      Throws:
      IOException - if IO error occurs.

    • applyToCurvData

      public List<Float> applyToCurvData(List<Float> curvData)
      Apply this label to a list of float values, such as the data in an FsCurv object. This makes sense only if the label is a surface label, and the list of float values contains per-vertex data for the same surface the label is defined on.
      Parameters:
      curvData - the list of float values to apply the label to. This function will return the subset of the data in the list that is part of the label.
      Returns:
      a new ArrayList containing the subset of the data in the input list that is part of the label. The size of the returned list is equal to the number of elements in this label.

    • applyToCurvData

      public List<Float> applyToCurvData(List<Float> curvData, boolean invert)
      Apply this label to a list of float values, such as the data in an FsCurv object. This makes sense only if the label is a surface label, and the list of float values contains per-vertex data for the same surface the label is defined on.
      Parameters:
      curvData - the list of float values to apply the label to. This function will return the subset of the data in the list that is part of the label.
      invert - if set to True, the values returned will be only the values which are NOT part of the label.
      Returns:
      a new ArrayList containing the subset of the data in the input list that is part of the label. The size of the returned list is equal to the number of elements in this label.

    • applyToCurv

      public List<Float> applyToCurv(FsCurv curv) throws IOException
      Apply this label to an FsCurv object containing per-vertex data. This makes sense only if the label is a surface label, and the list of float values contains per-vertex data for the same surface the label is defined on.
      Parameters:
      curv - the FsCurv object to apply the label to. This function will return the subset of the data in the FsCurv object that is part of the label.
      Returns:
      a new ArrayList containing the subset of the data in the FsCurv object that is part of the label. The size of the returned list is equal to the number of elements in this label.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs, e.g. if the label contains vertex indices that are out of bounds for the FsCurv data.

    • applyToCurv

      public List<Float> applyToCurv(FsCurv curv, boolean invert) throws IOException
      Apply this label to an FsCurv object containing per-vertex data. This makes sense only if the label is a surface label, and the list of float values contains per-vertex data for the same surface the label is defined on.
      Parameters:
      curv - the FsCurv object to apply the label to. This function will return the subset of the data in the FsCurv object that is part of the label.
      invert - if set to True, the values returned will be only the values which are NOT part of the label.
      Returns:
      a new ArrayList containing the subset of the data in the FsCurv object that is part of the label. The size of the returned list is equal to the number of elements in this label.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs, e.g. if the label contains vertex indices that are out of bounds for the FsCurv data.
